Description: full on off stump, a hint of away shape, good stride forward for a crisp push-drive to mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
lovely shot to get CSK off the mark. Length ball again, a bit more width on this occasion, and Gaikwad presses forward before opening his bat face to ease the ball between point and backward point
fullish, angling into the pads, and there's some late movement away, off the pitch, as Gaikwad attempts the flick. Leading edge flies in the air and bounces down to the right of deep backward point
length ball outside off, presses forward and punches firmly to short extra-cover

shot! That's not particularly short, and it only gets up to about thigh height, but Gaikwad swivels quickly on his back foot and pulls it along the floor, placing it a long way to the left of long leg
length ball angling across to finish close to off stump, gets forward and pushes to the left of point, who moves quickly to cut off the single
first six of the innings, and it's a top shot from Conway. Steps out, steps away to the leg side to create room, and slices this ball, with the angle, over cover point and all the way for six
steps out again and Hardik shortens his length while following Conway's movement to the leg side. Defended into the mid-off region
back of a length, nips back in towards off stump. Looks to dab into the point region with an open face, gets a thick inside edge into the backward square leg region
delivers one on the pads now, and Conway just whips it away fine, too file for long leg to be able to cut it off. Just the kind of over CSK needed to get themselves going
shuffles out to this length ball finishing near the top of off stump. Opens his bat face to dab to the right of backward point for a quick single
back of a length, angling away from off stump, flat-batted along the ground to the right of long-on
slower ball on the pads, clipped to the left of short fine leg. No pace to work with at all

slower ball slanting away from the left-hander and landing wide of off stump. Dube is in position for the big hit weeks before thre ball reaches him, and in the end he just lets the ball hit his bat, bewildered, and the ball loops over the bowler's head and lands roughly where he began his run-up
goes short and into the pitch, offcutter finishing chest high just outside off. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket

gone. Mohit's lack of pace gets another wicket. Back of a length, outside off, it's there for the slash over point in everry way except it's the back-of-the-hand slowie. Stops on Rahane, and he ends up punching it in the air and straight to the man at deep point
quick length ball nipping in towards middle stump, and Rayudu gets forward for a punch to long-on
short outside off, turns away further. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
flat length ball straightening from an off-stumpish line. Looks to go over the top, but loses his shape and ends up dragging it to deep midwicket, all along the floor
quick legbreak outside off, goes back and punches it back to the bowler
full now, too full to get underneath, driven along the ground to long-off

finally, Dube finds some rhythm. Wrong'un, turning away from off stump, and it lands just a touch too full from Rashid. It's in Dube's arc, and he clears his front leg, keeps his head still, and hits it clean and flat over the straight long-on boundary

six more. Dube has arrived alright. This is a legbreak straightening towards off stump, and again it's in Dube's hitting arc. Clears that front leg again, and hits this one higher but just as cleanly, all the way over long-on
trademark Rayudu shot. Mohit bowls a rare slot ball. It's a slower ball but it's the wrong length, and Rayudu steps leg side to create hitting room, and launches it high over long-off
Four more, and Rayudu is finishing in style. Another error from Mohit. Full-toss outside off, and Rayudu lashes it to the right of the diving extra-cover fielder

terrific shot. Stunning. Back of a length outside off, and Rayudu sits on the back foot, deep in his crease, and launches it with a  straight bat over the long-off boundary, finishing with his bat following through over his left shoulder. Incredible

gone, but what a terrific little cameo to end his IPL career. Quick, hard length, on the stumps, and Rayudu, looking to go over long-on, ends up slicing the ball with his bat turning in his hand. No distance on it, and he pops back the simplest of return catches

and he's gone first ball! He was out caught at extra-cover in Qualifer 1, and he's out caught at extra-cover in the final. Full, it's there to drive over extra-cover, but he doesn't get the elevation he wants, and the ball ends up in the safe hands of David Miller. What a moment
full, slanting away from off stump, driven with an open face to the right of deep point
full, angling in to finish just outside off, driven to long-off
short, angling across to finish in the corridor. Thinks of the uppercut, decides against it in the end, hoping for a wide. It isn't a wide

another good short ball, ending up over Dube's back shoulder. Difficult to control the pull from there, and he ends up hitting it in the air, but lands it in the wide spaces between short fine and deep backward square leg
in the blockhole, angling in towards off stump, clipped to the right of deep midwicket
length ball, angling in towards off stump, ends up a little cramped for room even though he clears his front leg. Drags a swipe to deep backward square leg off the inside half of his bat

full-toss, low full-toss, angling in towards off stump, and Jadeja completely mishits it. Looks to go over long-on, and ends up scooping it towards deep backward square leg. Noor runs in quickly off the rope and dives forward, but he can't reach the ball in time
perfect off-stump yorker, and all Dube can do is get his front leg out of the way and jam his bat down. Jabbed straight back to the bowler
another excellent blockhole ball, slanting across to off stump. This time Dube manages to jab it for a single down to long-off
low, unhittable full-toss on leg stump. Clears his front leg, and he tries to manufacture some sort of elevation but all he can do is hit it to long-on, on the bounce, for a single
low full-toss slanting away from off stump, and again it's too low for any elevation. Goes down the ground, hits it on the bounce to long-off. Another single

SIX! You only have to miss the yorker by a few inches, and you disappear. Looks for the stump yorker, lands it slightly short of where he's aiming, and ends up offering a slot ball that Jadeja launches over long-on, clean and flat. Stunning

Jadeja's done it! CSK have won their fifth IPL title!CSK's players run onto the field as one, but MS Dhoni remains in the dugout, eyes closed. An incredible final over from Mohit Sharma ends with two marginal errors. First, an error of length, ended up as a straight six. Then an error of line. Low full-toss, but it's on the pads, and Jadeja swings at it and gets enough bat on it to get it into the gap, fine of short fine leg. What a match. Shame it's been shortened by rain, but the finish has been worth everything that went before
shot. Back of a length ball angling in to finish around fourth stump, and Conway presses forwarfd and swats it between mid-on and midwicket

four more. Superb wristwork on this occasion. Uses the round-the-wicket angle expertly, meets this length ball on an off-stumpish line and whips it behind square, in the air, beats deep backward square leg sprinting to his left
steps out, steps leg-side, and gets leg-side of a leg-stump ball to slice it to the right of deep backward point
past the edge! Back of a length in the corridor, and it nips away with extra bounce as Gaikwad looks to jab it away square without moving his feet
length ball straightening towards the top of off stump. Stays leg side of the ball and manufactures a soft-hands single into the off side
length ball on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
shot! Makes room to a slightly short-of-length ball straightening towards off stump, and punches it brilliantly to find the gap to the left of backward point

senses that he'll try and make room again and fires a quick legbreak at the pads. Misses the flick, and gets a leg bye into the off side. Lbw appeal is quickly aborted because it pitched outside leg, hit the pad outside leg, and was missing leg stump on a second set of imaginary stumps
steps out to a ball turning from leg to middle and pushes inside-out towards cover
premeditates a sweep to a ball that's too short for the stroke, and he's beaten and smacked in the chest for his troubles. Picks up a leg bye, though
bam. CSK are getting off to a great start here. Wrong'un from Rashid, on the fuller side, and he gets his front leg out of the way to manufacture room and launch it sweetly over mid-off
just a touch short, legbreak turning away from off stump, and Gaikwad makes room for the square-cut and beats backward point diving to his right
back of a length wide of off stump, reaches out and stabs to the right of deep backward point
looks to make room and the wrong'un follows him, keeps a bit low too. Punched back to the bowler off the back foot
full outside off, too full to get underneath. Driven down to long-off, all along the ground
back of a length, straightens towards the top of off. Makes room and punches to the off-side sweeper
wrong'un, I think? Looped up wide outside off, and Conway snatches too eagerly at the cover drive. Ends up dragging it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
shortish wrong'un finishing on the pads. Swipes it to the right of short fine leg, where Josh Little makes a good diving stop

short on off stump, Conway pulls and hits it in the air, but doesn't middle it and the ball lands safely in front of deep midwicket, where Rashid runs in from the boundary and to his right and overruns the nball a little

another short ball, gets up a little higher outside off, and Conway pulls into the gap to the right of Rashid at deep midwicket. He overruns the ball again, but turns around quickly and fields it casually with his left hand
back of a length close to off stump, punched to extra-cover. Seemed to stop on him slightly
back of a length, angling across to off stump, clears the front leg and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket

slower ball, fullish on off stump, makes a bit of room and drives to the right of Miller at extra-cover. Moves quickly to the ball and throws at the keeper's end, with no one backing up, and concedes an overthrow
shot! First post-powerplay boundary and it's a six. Not a genuine half-tracker, but it sits up nicely outside off for Conway to pull with conviction and clear the midwicket boundary
tossed up on leg stump, gets forward to clip to long-on
full on off stump, once again too full for elevation. Driven down to the left of long-on, and Gaikwad is interested in a second but Conway sends him back

wrong'un, dangled across Gaikwad and pitching outside off before turning further away. Don't know if he picked it, and if he did he's been done in the air by some dip. Looks to go over long-on, ends up getting a top-edge that skews high in the air before Rashid settles under it at backward point
wrong'un, full and turning in from off stump, gets forward and clips to deep backward square leg

another wrong'un, pitching just short of driving length outside off. Looks to chip to long-off's right, I think, and it turns in and hits the inside half of the bat, and he ends up chipping to long-off's left

Noor bags his second of the over. What an over. Back of a length, and this one turns away from Conway, and it stops on him as well. Lets out a yell of frustration after mishitting it straight down long-off's throat. Was probably looking to hit it over extra-cover off the back foot, not an easy shot to play at all
short, gets up to shoulder height over off stump. Pulled in the air, but lands dafely in front of Noor running to his right from deep square leg
Now he goes short at Rahane, and he doesn't middle his pull at all. Checks his shot and picks up two, since the fielder has to run in a long way from deep midwicket

walloped. Little slants this back-of-a-length ball across Rahane, finishing just outside off, and he just stands there and baseballs it over the midwicket boundary. Somewhere in between a horizontal-bat and a straight-bat shot
full outside off, punched to extra-cover

is this the shot of the match? Half-volley on off stump, but how sweet was the timing? Just gets his front leg out of the way and extends his arms through a straight-bat drive to launch it effortlessly over the straight long-off boundary
short now, gets up to chest height, pulled along the ground towards deep midwicket
length ball turning in from an off-stumpish line. Presses forward  and dabs into the off side to bring Dube on strike
back of a length, flat, straightens close to off stump, punched to long-off
back of a length close to off stump. Looks to make room and cut, and gets a thick edge that rolls towards short third

beats him with turn. Flat length ball fairly wide of off stump, and Dube was looking to make a bit of room and crash it over long-off, probably. Beats his outside edge, and Saha whips off the bails. He hasn't lifted his back foot or dragged it out, though
fullish on off stump, clipped down to long-on

quickish wrong'un, pitching outside leg, and Noor finishes with figures of 2-17 in three overs after Rahane misses the flick and gets hit on the pad. Superb bowling in difficult circumstances in a massive, massive game
back of a length, straightens towards middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and muscles it along the ground to deep midwicket
steps out, and Rashid widens his line. Looks to hit over extra-cover, and gets a thick edge that loops up and lands to the right of short third

Clears his front leg to go over long-on, but Rashid fires this too full for that. Thick inside edge dribbles out into the square leg region, and there's no one in the circle there. Rashid gives chase himself, and the batters sneak a quick second run

Dube isn't in rhythm just yet. Quickish and fairly full, turning from leg stump towards his cleared front leg. Inside half of the bat as he looks to go big, and the ball lands well short of long-on, to his left
wrong'un, turns down leg, and Rahane sinks onto his back knee quickly and sweeps it away to the left of short fine leg

four more! Similar shot, more of a kneeling pull than a proper sweep, and again he hits the wrong'un to the left of short fine. Deep backward square leg gives chase to his right and puts in a full-length dive, but it's in vain
